source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves narrow-ovate to ovate in outline, entire or lobed, pungent-pointed, margins not recurved, upper surface shiny
Leaves broad-oblong to obovate, entire, mucronate, margins recurved, upper surface dull green, under surface paler; mostly from high-altitude areas
Leaves lobed; bracteoles absent; calyx 3–5 mm long, teeth shorter than tube; East Gippsland only
Leaves entire; bracteoles present; calyx 6–9 mm long, teeth about equal to tube
